intro: Centaurium virescens, commonly known as green centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm. The plant features slender, erect stems covered with fine hairs and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy as well. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense umbels, and have five petals that are usually pink or purple in color. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
